decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive play with a combination of creatures that generate value upon death, such as Blood Artist and Xathrid Necromancer, along with token generators like Lingering Souls and Gather the Townsfolk. It also includes removal spells like Tragic Slip and Orzhov Charm to maintain board control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells while utilizing the Orzhov colors for additional synergy and flexibility. With a solid mana base and a mixture of threats and answers, this deck looks to apply consistent pressure and close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells and counterspells to deal with the opponent's threats. It also utilizes card draw and life gain to maintain card advantage and survive against aggressive decks. The deck includes a mix of removal spells like Warped Physique, Tragic Slip, Supreme Verdict, Far / Away, Doom Blade, and counterspells like Dissipate and Syncopate. It also includes card advantage tools like Think Twice and Sphinx's Revelation. The deck's win conditions come from creatures like Snapcaster Mage, Lifebane Zombie, Augur of Bolas, and Restoration Angel. The mana base consists of a combination of dual lands to support the deck's three-color requirements.

This deck focuses on using removal spells and creatures with graveyard interaction to control the game. By utilizing cards like Desecration Demon, Liliana of the Veil, and Mutilate, the deck aims to keep the opponent's board clear while building up its own resources. Thragtusk and Scavenging Ooze provide additional value and resilience against aggressive decks. The inclusion of cards like Lifebane Zombie and Geralf's Messenger adds disruption and pressure to the opponent. Overall, this deck seeks to grind out advantages over time and outvalue the opponent in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing mana acceleration from Arbor Elf and Elvish Mystic, the deck can start deploying threats as early as turn two. The aggressive creatures like Flinthoof Boar, Ghor-Clan Rampager, and Hellrider put pressure on the opponent while cards like Thundermaw Hellkite provide a powerful finisher. The deck also includes removal spells like Bonfire of the Damned and Mizzium Mortars to deal with opposing threats. Domri Rade provides card advantage and creature removal, further enhancing the deck's aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and utilizing mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Arbor Elf and Elvish Mystic to ramp into powerful threats like Thundermaw Hellkite and Hellrider, the deck aims to close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of removal spells like Mizzium Mortars and creature-enhancing spells like Ghor-Clan Rampager help to push through any blockers the opponent may have. The key strategy is to maintain pressure and tempo to secure victory.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and quick damage output. By utilizing mana ramp and efficient creatures like Arbor Elf and Elvish Mystic, the deck can quickly deploy threats like Thundermaw Hellkite, Hellrider, and Ghor-Clan Rampager. Domri Rade provides card advantage and removal options, while Kessig Wolf Run can give creatures trample for maximum damage potential. The deck's focus is on applying pressure early and maintaining board presence to finish the game quickly.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, utilizing mana acceleration through Arbor Elf and Elvish Mystic to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Thundermaw Hellkite and Hellrider. Domri Rade provides card advantage and creature removal, while Ghor-Clan Rampager and Flinthoof Boar offer additional pump effects to push through damage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of efficient creatures and burn spells like Mizzium Mortars, aiming to end the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Arbor Elf and Elvish Mystic. By playing powerful creatures like Thundermaw Hellkite, Hellrider, and Ghor-Clan Rampager, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Cards like Domri Rade and Mizzium Mortars provide additional support and removal options. Overall, the strategy revolves around applying early pressure and maintaining a strong board presence to secure a swift victory.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Arbor Elf and Elvish Mystic, allowing for early plays of powerful creatures like Thundermaw Hellkite and Hellrider. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Mizzium Mortars to clear the way for aggressive attacks. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with hasty, high-impact creatures while maintaining a steady flow of pressure throughout the game. The combination of fast mana generation, impactful creatures, and removal spells makes this deck a relentless force on the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures like Voice of Resurgence and Cartel Aristocrat. The deck also utilizes sacrifice effects like Blood Artist and varolz, the Scar-Striped to punish opponents for blocking or removing your creatures. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Garruk Relentless and Obzedat, Ghost Council for added value and finishing power. Lingering Souls and Collective Blessing help go wide and pump your creatures for a strong final push.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a variety of removal spells and planeswalkers to dominate the board. The creatures in the deck have abilities that help maintain board control, while also dealing direct damage to the opponent. The mana base is designed to provide access to a variety of colors to support the spells and creatures in the deck. Overall, the key strategy is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently removing threats and using powerful creatures and planeswalkers to secure victory.

The deck revolves around using cards like Unburial Rites and Faithless Looting to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Thragtusk, and Elderscale Wurm into the graveyard and then reanimate them onto the battlefield for game-winning combos. The deck also includes removal spells like Pillar of Flame and Doom Blade to control the board, as well as lands that provide a variety of colored mana for casting spells of different colors. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while disrupting their strategy with removal spells.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently fill up the graveyard with creatures, use cards like Grisly Salvage and Mulch to find key combo pieces, and then reanimate powerful creatures like Angel of Serenity and Thragtusk to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes mana acceleration cards like Avacyn's Pilgrim and Elvish Mystic to help get the combo pieces out faster. The combination of graveyard recursion and powerful creatures creates a strong synergy that can quickly turn the tide of the game in the player's favor.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures and turning them into powerful attackers with cards like Rancor, Selesnya Charm, and Ajani, Caller of the Pride. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures like Voice of Resurgence, Loxodon Smiter, and Silverblade Paladin, backed up by removal and protection spells like Faith's Shield and Scavenging Ooze. The mana base ensures a consistent flow of mana for both creatures and spells, while Mutavault provides additional attacker flexibility. Overall, this deck aims to be fast and aggressive, putting pressure on the opponent early in the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing creatures with strong abilities and synergies to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck includes cards that provide protection and evasion for key creatures, as well as removal options to deal with opposing threats. The goal is to establish a board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game, ultimately closing out the match with efficient attacks and powerful abilities. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to both colored and colorless sources, enabling a smooth curve of threats and answers.
